reviews.review: Buy this game.

This game is down-right MINDBLOWING. If the beautiful atmosphere and submersive environment and characters do not astound you, the convoluted and twisting storyline will! 10/10 and just what you would expect from the mastermind that created the first Bioshock over 5 years ago. Beautiful, emersive, eye catching; this game will forever change how you view video games and the story within them!
I'm sure you've all heard the hype.  This game has unbelievable visuals, a great story, and satisfying gunplay.  Even if you're not big on FPS games, you owe it to yourself to play this one!

I first played this 8 years ago and thought it was shit at the time so I decided to try it again today to see if I was correct in my first assumption. After 15 minutes the game froze my system and forced me to hard reboot my PC twice. Two thumbs down, shit game. Hope Ken Levine continues to lose sleep over fan art of the deuteragonist getting spunked on.

Buy this game right now...
It could end up being GOTY!


Køb det lige nu!

Такое добро уже давно не делают. Тут глаза радуются (дизайн уровней, концепция), и слух (отлично подобранные голоса персонажей, а так же ряд композиций, которые вы сможете услышать в фонографах), и, что главное, душа. Интересные, колоритные и проработанные персонажи, оставляющие столько же вопросов, сколько восхищение; начиная прекрасной и невинной Элизабет, заканчивая расистким и странным Комстоком.
Сюжет выше всяких похвал. Незабываемая Колумбия - воздушный замок (в прямом и переносном смысле), где всего есть по-немногу. Вообще - ближе к концу сценарист нас заставляет задумыться о таких философских темах, вроде жизни после смерти (да, спойлер).
Unreal Engine 3 - заезжанный движок, но здесь он открывается в абсолютно новом свете. Думаю, иной движок никак бы не вписался в концепцию игры. Есть и маленькие недочёты, как отстуствие теней в некоторых местах. Было чувство, что я играю призраком.
Итог: Сюжет - 10/10; Звук и музыка - 10/10; Графика - 9.5/10; Управление - 8.5/10 = 10/10 баллов. (Так-то оценка 9.5, но зачем замарачиваться?)

Playing on hard and stopping to smell the flowers (Reading things on walls, looking around, etc.) I clocked 13.2 hrs for my first playthrough. This game cost $80 WITHOUT dlc currently and I think it is a bit crazy considering there is no multiplayer or survival, anything like that.

But that being said the story, immersion, graphics and first person shooter elements are all blended in perfectly together and make for a wonderful experience, although again I'm not sure the price is quite justified.

For the game itself and not it's value for money I think the 96/100 metascore rating is well deserved and an immersive leap into the floating city of Columbia!
One of the best game franchises ever.
If you haven't played this game put your hand over your face and ask the closest person to punch your hand.
DAS beste Spiel! Glaubt mir, sowas habt ihr noch nicht gespielt! Unbedingt kaufen :3

One of the very few games I would truely call a masterpiece and I would say its my favorite game of all time!  I must have for fans of Bioshock franchise or anyone who enjoys a truely awesome game.

There aren't many games that will leave you pondering for days on end. Bioshock was certainly one. Infinite manages to do it again. And again, the plot, story, characters and atmosphere (lol) are the highlights. Combat mechanics are certainly improved and more varied this time around, but all around similar. Powers, guns and arenas. What drives this game is Elizabeth. She stays with you most of the game, and with stunning AI. She interacts with the environment, talks to you, leads you. She will aid in combat, though it's no escort mission. But in truth, it is. She escorts you though time and space to places we never thought possible in a game. PLAY THIS NOW.

I did not see what all the hype was about when playing this since i did not find it to be a 10/10 game. 
+ Amazing story 
+ finally a AI which surprisingly is not frustrating to play with.
+ Vigors which is potions that does different things such as levitating people and burning them to a crisp. That helps to keep the combat fresh and varied.
+ Handyman enemies which are a delight to fight againts since you have to be fast and precise.

- Flat out boring weapons.
- Even more boring weapon upgrades.
- The hype about this game puts you expectations through the roof and you feel a bit let down afterwards.
- Enemies are just thrown at you all the time and combat which makes it a bit dull.
Indispensable
THE BEST GAME EVER !! :)
5/5, 10/10 and 100/100. That is all.

Great story, everyone should play this game at some point.

Amazing, outstanding, and very complex plot, but very generic and stupid gameplay mechanics. The First-person shooter type of game does not suit this amazing setting and story. If this game was an RPG with better gameplay style than this, this game would be the meaning of perfectness.

Game of the year without a doubt!

It is a must for the average gamer.

This is a perfect example of how a single player game should be made. Fun, addictive, great story telling, beautiful scenary, intense and gives you the feel to want to play it all over again. Truly one of the best games of 2013 and needs to be played by any old or new commers to the bioshock series. 10/10.

Its now been about a week since I've beaten Bioshock Infinite, and I'm still having issues trying to figure out where I stand on it. Don't get me wrong, the story is amazing, and the combat I had a lot of fun with (keeping the two weapon max system in mind), but is it really as perfect as every reviewer would have you believe? Well, kinda. Its not perfect by any stretch of the means. Granted, its really good, but is it 10/10 good. The answer is no. The story deserves it, without a doubt, but the game lets you down with its very linear progression, the two weapon system, and a few of the bosses and heavy hitters are such a pain you could empty the ammo of everything you have, and your salts, and all the weapons you find around you. At that point, it makes the combat not even feel satisfying, especially when after 3 deaths the game toys with you by saying you can lower the difficulty. I truly hate it when games baby you like that. If I wanted to play on a lower difficulty, I would have played on a lower difficulty goddammit! The normal combat is fun and exciting though. With the vigors and skyrails, you have tons of combinations at your fingertips to how to approach your targets. For those who were fans of the extra mechanics of the first two Bioshock games might find Infinite disappointing. After having some time to think about it, I actually miss hacking machines to cause discounts and free money. Now its just, posses things and get some free money. It feels, lacking. Speaking of lacking, along with the two weapon system, we also don't have the extra ammo types from the last two. I never used them much, but its nice to have the option. Some of the enemies take too many shots to kill, so you get to run around looking for more ammo mid fight, which isn't a lot of fun in my opinion. Lastly, there's the story and Elizabeth. Elizabeth actually makes combat more interesting. She can throw you what you need in a fight, and also seems to always find some money the second you're done buying what you need. The best part about her though, is the game isn't an escort mission, and Elizabeth can't die! As for the story, its very engaging, as long as you're paying attention to your surroundings and listening to audio logs (which also make a return) to find out more about this crazy world in the sky. Plus, the story gives you reason to replay the game. If you have heard anything about the ending, or have seen it, you know where I'm going with this. The ending is so much plot wrapped into such a small timeframe, it made my mouth drop when the bigger elements were revealed. It made me want to replay the game just to find out what I missed throughout the game. Overall, the game is incredible. Its not the 10/10 its being given, but it definitely deserves a low 9 or high 8. It is by far a contender for game of the year, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a good story from the game, as long as they don't mind the combat.

Never I have ever been drown into the atmosphere of the game as in this game. Beautifully created game with very interesting story, which in the end blew my mind. Vast interesting world made me search most corners for interesting objects, find hidden little details and listen the sounds + random narratives. What made me mesmerized was to follow different options/routes Elizabeth was coded to move around. Combat system is one of my favourites. In my opinion, one of the best game I have played without getting boored at any time and easy favourite top 3 game.

This....this is game of the year stuff. It flawlessly incorperates gameplay that is fun, with a setting and story that is interesting, with characters you will love and love to hate. Even the guns are satisfying in conjunction with the vigors. Get it as soon as possible!

I honestly don't want to put words here. Why you ask? Its simple, this game takes your breath away. Every single element of amazing is stitched into a seemless gameplay that you just cannot put down. If you even remotely call yourself a gamer YOU NEED this game. Best BEST BEST game I've ever played. Hands down.

Meiner Meinug nach ist Bioshock Infinite ein gelungener Nachfolger für die BioShock-Reihe. Die Story ist spannend und bietet eine schöne Atmosphere, zwar nicht so wie die Unterwasserstad Rapture aber auch sehr beeindruckend.

Eine schöne Neuerung in Infinite sind die "Sky-Lines":
 Man schwingt sich mit seiner Waffe in der Hand an Metallschienen durch die Lüfte und es gleicht etwas einer Achterbahn. 

Zu den Waffen an sich braucht man eigendlich nicht zu sagen, verschiedene Waffentypen die sich alle in Schaden, Magazingröße, etc. verbessern lassen.
Etwas schade finde ich es allerdings das man nur zwei Waffen mit sich tragen kann, darüber lässt sich aber einfach hinwegsehen.

Abschliessend bleibt nur noch zu sagen, dass mir dieses Spiel wirklich viel Spaß gemacht hat.

Игра выше всяких похвал. 9,5 из 10. Красива, динамична, интересна, а глубокий сюжет не отпускает до самых титров. Может показаться, что концовку игры трезвым не понять, но когда происходит инсайт, что может быть лучше? Не забудьте посмотреть титры до конца.

Отдельно слово про DLC, в частности Episode 2.
Если вы не играли в него, вы не видели Bioshock, ни одну из его частей. Без DLC вся трилогия не имеет смысла.

Пройдите обязательно.

This is most certaintly one of the best gaming experiences of this generation! (Definately the best for me)

It has fast paced combat made more dynamic by utilising the skylines to your advantage, using gears you can customise and enhance how the skyline effects combat, for example I used a gear that had an area of effect fire damage when landing from the skyline or making a skyline strike attack.

Elizabeth is a massive help in combat, sometimes she will throw a health kit at you saving your life when you are running low, or ammo and salts to keep you supplied. The great thing about her is that she does not require protection during combat so she won't hold you back.

The story is interactive, cutscenes do not play much of a part in it at all, I've only experienced 2 moments in which booker's movements are scripted and they are very short and necessary for the story. The story itself is really intriguing centering around Elizabeth who could be compared to a disney princess you save from a tower guarded by a dragon (yes the dragon is Songbird).

The world of Columbia is an incredible feat of design, simply awe inspiring to look at when rising through the clouds from the classic lighthouse setting on your first visit. The people of the city are just as interesting, with a tense atmosphere between two ways of life about to spark a civil war the game tackles some dark themes.

The ending itself is.... INCREDIBLE! 

You should all know the basic synopsis of the story... it's amazing get it now...
Very good atmosphere!
ULTRA GOOD GAME

Whilst the companion thing does work it is rather poorly designed with enemies completely ignoring her existence, even after enemies talk about how they're going to murder her.

What is BioShock Infinite? A surreal and thought out setting in a logically processed steam punk floating utopian city 'dubbed' Columbia, revolving around a beautifully performed actress that you will fall in love with the moment you meet her who is no damsel in distress; the combat is flawless. A game of 'Infinite' appraise from critics and fans alike, this game should be at the top of EVERYONES list for 2013.

There is really nothing I can say about this game that hasn't been said already.  This is by far one of the best games I've played in many years.  From the storyline to the gameplay, this is a winner.  It keeps you interested all the way through, and once you finally get 1999 Mode, the action becomes something truly incredible.  If you havn't bought this, or say it hasn't lived up to the hype...play it, or play it again.  Its a masterpiece in gaming, and one owes it to themselves to at least try it, to at least experience the beginning.

Edit: I keep thinking over my original review, and I feel I should kinda make it, you know, a proper review, and give the goods with the bads.  I'm a little bit biased, as I LOVE this game, and would go as far as to say it's one of, if not the best video game that has come out since the golden age of gaming.  Yes, that's a bold statement, but I think I can back it up.

First of all, I should state what isn't so good: the combat.  I just got the dlc, and honestly, I hadn't played in a little while, so I was rusty.  Slowly but surely, I started to notice that even though it was fun to play and shoot stuff, it didn't have the impact so many other games like it have.  A lot of people don't like gore, but really, it's here to stay.  Many gorier games have combat that's just plain gut-wrenching, where you literally feel the bullets fly out of your fun.  This game doesn't have that as much, and with the storyline it has got, the combat shouldnt only look viseral, it should sound and feel viseral too.  I can say that's my only complaint, and it isn't much of one either, as it's still fun to play, just not as good as could be hoped. 

Now, to what I bypassed in the original review: the attention to detail.  The world of Infinite is a living, breathing society.  It has relatable characters, even in it's villains, (cough cough like Andrew Ryan cough) and an incredible vision of this world.  The future songs reverted to the music of years past.  The scenes of the future, and the confusion of these from the protagonist.  The ruddy landscape, like heaven itself, gleaming down upon you! 

 This game, in terms of what it sometimes doesn't say, and in terms of how the makers of it worked, is damn near perfect.  I've never just not wanted the game to end, and afterwards, not even want a sequel to it, as it couldn't even compare to it's predecessor.  If you haven't played this game, please...would you kindly pay the money, and pay attention to what isn't said in this masterpiece?  Don't just play the game: with mouse or controller in hand, live it.  That's the only way to appreciate it fully.

Awesome Story, Awesome gameplay, Awesome graphics, Awesome characters! (Hey! I just made an anaphora!) It is a MUST have!

10/10 Go through all the doors!
A must play, if you don't know by now. A great ending as well.

One of the best games I have played in a while. The story line had me hooked from the get go and left me in awe by the end of the game. For anyone that is familiar with first person shooters I would highly suggest playing through the game on hard rather than normal as the difficulty is much more balanced and challenging while not being overbearingly difficult.

I would also suggest adjusting the field of view in the settings as the extended field of view really makes the game feel more life-like than the default setting. Similarly, if you are having problems with your mouse being "floaty" even after disabling mouse acceleration try turning off VSync or its in game equivalent (the in game menu calls it something different but the description is the same as VSync for other games).

All in all a great game. Highly recommended.

The best game I have ever played by far. The story-line is so epicly good it does not need anything else except a Single player campaign, you will absolutely not be disappointed, the most amazing story driven game ever created and nothing will touch it for a very long time. Worth every penny, worth every second.

Muito recomendado. A direção artística desse jogo é impecável, estilo muito interessante, nível de detalhes incrível, desde os posteres, propagandas, até o posicionamento dos itens dentro das construções. A história é contada de uma forma que me agrada bastante, faz o jogador explorar para saber mais e interação com a Elizabeth é sensacional, os personagens de forma geral são bem carismáticos. A jogabilidade não é nada revolucionária, mas agrada. Bioshock Infinite vale a pena.
Just plain flat out awesome!

This manages to be the most creative, brutally violent game I've ever played. Every little detail is important, has a meaningful purpose, and serves to flesh the story out in a manner which will make you shit yourself so hard by the time you reach the end that you will need an entirely new ass afterwards. If you plan on playing this game, and by all means you really fucking should, DON'T let anyone spoil anything for you, and certainly don't spoil anything for yourself either.

Settingwise, any idiot could point out to you that it's 180 degrees from the underwater city in the original game--this time you're in the fucking sky in 1912--but it's also a bit like Sky Captain and The World of Tomorrow, in that it's kind of like what people actually living in the year 1912 would have written into their idea of a science fiction story based on how people saw the world at the time. Instead of terminators and spahce mahrenes with laser guns and self-aware computer programs, there are clockwork tin soldiers and World War I-era weapons, and giant electric superconductors taken directly out of Nikola Tesla's theoretical designs; and because it's nineteen-fucking-twelve, everyone has a fabulous gentlemannly beard, top hat, and deep-seated racism against Irish people. But it transcends a simple steampunk label; essentially, it's what would happen if Tesla, Jules Verne and Bertrand Russel combined their century-old powers of kickassery and made a video game about a fictionalized version of the time they lived in, complete with floating cities, quantum metaphysics, and theoretical concepts in epistemology which were contemporary with the great thinkers of that era. Come to think of it, that may be what actually happened.

TL;DR you can make your enemies' heads violently explode by electrocuting them, 10000000000000000000000000000000000/10 GOTY, fucking get it.
Absolutely brilliant game, a must get! Don't have to have played the previous two, but if you haven't go back and play those also

Incredible visual design and attentive world-building marred only occasionally by hurried level design and outdated combat mechanics. Nevertheless, BioShock Infinite remains a fairly solid shooter that will be sure to please fans of Irrational's previous work, just as long as expectations are held in check. Don't rush to see the ending -- it goes out of its way to tie everything up neatly with a Möbius ribbon but overreaches -- just soak up as much of the rest of the game as you can.
If your playing bioshock ifinite take a methodical approach, sit back and relax and enjoy the wonderfull story of columbia unfold a true masterpeice of game noire.

What Arkham City did for gameplay (just a year and a half ago!) this did for story; if you know me, I mean this as the highest praise. Never a second went by when I wasn't wrapping my head around new events and themes. While the graphics are not the most technically proficient I have seen, they are perhaps the most gorgeous I've seen. While FPS gunplay is not my biggest cuppa tea, it is made interesting through diverse and useful powers. A further comparison to Arkham City: Colombia is a real place. While you are playing, you are in a different world, one you might like to visit despite is numerous troubles, simply because it is that real and fantastical. The characters there (note I say "there" not "in the game" since Columbia is real to me) bring the city to life, Elizabeth especially so. Everything she does is so natural it's easy to forget she's a piece of AI.

I'll end my rambling praise and leave you to play it yourselves. It was worth the $60 to me to play the game before someone spoiled it all.

After playing the previous Bioshock games and loving both of them I knew I would get this one when it was released. It has a deep and compelling story and the gameplay is solid yet fluid. I will say my brain was a little scrambled by the story but it was worth every second.

Really great story rich FPS game, with a lot of action.

Game story is alright nothing special, game play feels average. Art style is nice, enviroments are ok. My honest opinion the original Bioshock was a lot better no player influence to effect ending at all.

tl;dr: EXTREMELY overrated game, if you want a Bioshock experience, look back to the first or second installments, this one is not worth your time or money. 

PLEASE NOTE: This is for the base game, I do not own, and will not purchase any DLC for this mess of a "Bioshock" game.

I had pre-ordered this at the very last second because I wanted to see some critic reviews first... there were at least a dozen reviewers giving this game glowing - if not perfect - reviews, and I've gotta say, I've never felt more deceived, ripped off, or confused as to what they actually played.

First things first, this is NOT a Bioshock game, it may try to call itself one, but it is closer to Call of Duty or whatever other "modern" shooter you associate such gameplay mechanics as: regenerating health, 2 weapon carry, overuse of "press 'x' to do 'y'" prompts, and other similar elements with.

But let's not get ahead of ourselves, what about the non-combat parts you might ask?

The world just doesn't seem to recognize that you are there unless there is a scripted event or if you have enemies trying to kill you. NPCs are stuck on an animation loop with a thousand mile stare and provide zero interactivity. 

There is some eye candy in the visuals department no doubt, but the rest feels like you are window shopping. There's barely even any physics in the game - good luck trying to do something so mundane as knock over a box or have some kind of actual feedback when trying to interact with the world. 

In fact, for a game released in 2013, there are a lot of things that make you feel like the game is from early 3D FPS days: no facial animations on almost all of the character models, no actual weapon recoil (burst fire increases spread where applicable, that's it), weaponry that differs only with regard to how fast they fire, ultra-linear gameplay when trying to appear open-world, etc.

That is about as deep as the "show" part of the game goes unfortunately, and the "tell" isn't much better.

Elizabeth... where oh where to begin on this poorly conceived joke of a 'character'. Let's see, she's supposedly important to the plot, yet completely invisible to, and ignored by the world, friendly or hostile. She doesn't take damage from anything, so she's not any kind of escort. Despite throwing things to you throughout the game she "finds" (magically spawns), she's never actually seen picking up anything. In fact, the most you'll ever see her "do" is perhaps point at an item, but only when out of combat... and having lingered in an area for a while. And perhaps the worst part is that she is your 'key' to locked doors... you have to wait for her to come over and break locks before you can proceed forward in many areas. It doesn't help matters that she is a walking plot hole device either (as if the story needed any more of those), able to open... well, holes (or tears as the game calls it) to other locales and realities that they try to lead you to believe are parallel... but only when they decide that it makes sense in what they try to pass off as the story.

The main "bad guy" of the story barely even has any time in the actual game. There's a few scripted minutes where Comstock points out what you are up to plotwise, then he disappears for over half the game, shows up again for a few minutes, then disappears till the end of the game where he is killed in a cutscene. 

About the only good thing I can say about the 'tell' is that the voice work is well done, but that's really about it.

Choices in the game amount to absolutely nothing as well. There is no morality system, but rather an extremely half-assed "Do not steal or we will try to kill you" in a couple odd sections which makes no difference one way or the other. Moments where you are stopped and forced to pick something seemingly relevant to the plot are just as pointless due to the fact that not only do they not affect anything afterward, but even if they did, the way the game ends would make it a non-factor anyway.

So, surely the combat makes up for these many downfalls though right? Not. In. The. Slightest.

This is another case of a sequel being dumbed down for no discernible reason. There are a LOT of lowest common denominator gameplay mechanics in the combat - regenerating shield (not health thankfully), 2 weapon max carry, standard overly generic weaponry, no special ammo types, and combat that only [u]sometimes[/u] tries to give the illusion of options, but ultimately fails because of not only how arbitrary these choices are, but also because the simplest approach 99 times out of 100 is the most effective one... thanks in no small part to these nonsensical changes. It's as if they were embarrassed of what people liked about the actual Bioshock experience.

Odds are Elizabeth will give you way more than is needed to make any engagement fairly underwhelming as it is anyway. As soon as you drop below a certain % on your health, salts (EVE), or ammo, she'll magically "find" some more for you to use, and this happens EVERY battle, no matter if there actually was something there or not (because scavenging would actually mean she has to do something). This coding is so blatant that it is surprising that they didn't just stick a cooldown timer on the HUD somewhere. What's worse, this is the ONLY thing she 'contributes' (term used VERY loosely) to battles, as the rest of the time she is cowering (usually out in the open), despite having god mode and being completely ignored by enemies, or waiting for you to press a button to yell at her to pull something into the battlefield. She literally does nothing on her own which makes the endless praise all the more baffling that people laud upon her for being a good character when you have MUCH better examples from other games, such as Half-life 2's Alyx, Barney, and even the rebel allies, which can put up a good fight and even hold their own in the many situations you are presented with, that came out well over a decade ago! As it stands, Elizabeth has no presence in, or out of combat, she is just 'there' throughout the majority of the game, leaving you to wonder why they even bothered putting such a big focus on her in the design process.

Do you recall the ad where she was about to be hanged by an angry mob and your character swoops in to save her? Yeah that doesn't actually happen in-game... ever... in any shape or form.  It really should've, at least the damsel-in-distress bit it would invoke would justify her existence somewhat.

One of the very few similarities to Bioshock there actually are come in the form of plasmids... err... sorry I mean "Vigors". Unlike Bioshock though, these are much less varied than the preceding games, much less used by enemies (there's maybe half a dozen that actually use what you use out of the thousand or so enemies you'll fight), and they can be severely game breaking in a great many of the fights. 

Difficulty is another major issue for those of you who like a challenge. One of the biggest factors for me at least, this game just doesn't feel particularly difficult, like at all. There are a couple exchanges which can get heated here and there, but ultimately it is because you are dealing with an army of enemies rather than having a character that feels mortal, which is only further underlined when you "die", since you respawn back into the fight moments later. And no, this cannot be disabled unlike in Bioshock 1 & 2.

But otherwise, there you have it, what little that remains of Bioshock returns here in a heavily watered down form, with the rest of the gameplay being pulled from lowest common denominator shooters like Call of Duty and the like to make this mash-up of a game that I really regret purchasing. The game tries to be so much at once, much of which it never was in the first place, and fails in every regard.

I don't know what the hell other reviewers were playing, but if you have had the fortune to avoid this clunker, continue to do so.
Best game I've played in at least five years.  Absolutely stunning.

One of the best games I have ever played. Up there with Half-Life 2 and both Portal 1 & 2. Rarely has a game sucked me in so completely with compelling story and gameplay while creating one of the most awesome support companions of all time. Elizabeth stands alongside Alyx Vance and Farah in the pantheon of amazing female video game characters and may be my new personal favorite. If you haven't bought the game yet, BUY IT. PLAY IT. ENJOY IT. YOU'RE WELCOME.
If you play any game based on my recommendation, let it be this one. Let it be this one.
GOTY hands down.  Havn't played a masterpiece such as this for a long, long time.
So Speechless. Nothing to Say!
